channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GaraMoSt: Parallel Multi-Granularity Motion and Structural Modeling for Efficient Multi-Frame Interpolation in DSA Images
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate that GaraMoSt achieves the SOTA performance in accuracy, robustness, visual effects, and noise suppression, comprehensively surpassing MoSt-DSA and other natural scene VFI methods.

item.title: RAG-RewardBench: Benchmarking Reward Models in Retrieval Augmented Generation for Preference Alignment
item.description: Despite the significant progress made by existing retrieval augmented language models (RALMs) in providing trustworthy responses and grounding in reliable sources, they often overlook effective alignment with human preferences.

item.title: VIIS: Visible and Infrared Information Synthesis for Severe Low-light Image Enhancement
item.description: To address these limitations, we propose a novel task, dubbed visible and infrared information synthesis (VIIS), which aims to achieve both information enhancement and fusion of the two modalities.

item.title: Modality-Independent Graph Neural Networks with Global Transformers for Multimodal Recommendation
item.description: Our results indicate that the optimal $K$ for certain modalities on specific datasets can be as low as 1 or 2, which may restrict the GNNs' capacity to capture global information.

item.title: Spatio-Temporal Fuzzy-oriented Multi-Modal Meta-Learning for Fine-grained Emotion Recognition
item.description: However, existing FER methods face three key challenges in real-world applications: (i) they rely on large amounts of continuously annotated data to ensure accuracy since emotions are complex and ambiguous in reality, which is costly and time-consuming; (ii) they cannot capture the temporal heterogeneity caused by changing emotion patterns, because they usually assume that the temporal correlation within sampling periods is the same; (iii) they do not consider the spatial heterogeneity of different FER scenarios, that is, the distribution of emotion information in different data may have bias or interference.

item.title: Mix-LN: Unleashing the Power of Deeper Layers by Combining Pre-LN and Post-LN
item.description: In contrast, Post-Layer Normalization (Post-LN) preserves larger gradient norms in deeper layers but suffers from vanishing gradients in earlier layers.

item.title: Physics Reasoner: Knowledge-Augmented Reasoning for Solving Physics Problems with Large Language Models
item.description: Physics problems constitute a significant aspect of reasoning, necessitating complicated reasoning ability and abundant physics knowledge.

item.title: SEKE: Specialised Experts for Keyword Extraction
item.description: Relying on the insight that real-world keyword detection often requires handling of diverse content, we propose a novel supervised keyword extraction approach based on the mixture of experts (MoE) technique.

item.title: PsyDT: Using LLMs to Construct the Digital Twin of Psychological Counselor with Personalized Counseling Style for Psychological Counseling
item.description: Experimental results indicate that our proposed PsyDT framework can synthesize multi-turn dialogues that closely resemble real-world counseling cases and demonstrate better performance compared to other baselines, thereby show that our framework can effectively construct the digital twin of psychological counselor with a specific counseling style.

item.title: Few-shot Steerable Alignment: Adapting Rewards and LLM Policies with Neural Processes
item.description: As large language models (LLMs) become increasingly embedded in everyday applications, ensuring their alignment with the diverse preferences of individual users has become a critical challenge.

item.title: Nullu: Mitigating Object Hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models via HalluSpace Projection
item.description: By orthogonalizing the model weights, input features will be projected into the Null space of the HalluSpace to reduce OH, based on which we name our method Nullu.

item.title: FarExStance: Explainable Stance Detection for Farsi
item.description: We compare the performance of a fine-tuned multilingual RoBERTa model to several large language models in zero-shot, few-shot, and parameter-efficient fine-tuned settings on our new dataset.

item.title: AnySat: An Earth Observation Model for Any Resolutions, Scales, and Modalities
item.description: Geospatial models must adapt to the diversity of Earth observation data in terms of resolutions, scales, and modalities.

item.title: Mesoscopic Insights: Orchestrating Multi-scale & Hybrid Architecture for Image Manipulation Localization
item.description: Inspired by this, our paper explores how to simultaneously construct mesoscopic representations of micro and macro information for IML and introduces the Mesorch architecture to orchestrate both.

item.title: EscapeBench: Pushing Language Models to Think Outside the Box
item.description: Language model agents excel in long-session planning and reasoning, but existing benchmarks primarily focus on goal-oriented tasks with explicit objectives, neglecting creative adaptation in unfamiliar environments.

item.title: CA-Edit: Causality-Aware Condition Adapter for High-Fidelity Local Facial Attribute Editing
item.description: For efficient and high-fidelity local facial attribute editing, most existing editing methods either require additional fine-tuning for different editing effects or tend to affect beyond the editing regions.

item.title: Benchmarking and Improving Large Vision-Language Models for Fundamental Visual Graph Understanding and Reasoning
item.description: To study the reason behind these limitations, we propose VGCure, a comprehensive benchmark covering 22 tasks for examining the fundamental graph understanding and reasoning capacities of LVLMs.

item.title: Towards Efficient and Explainable Hate Speech Detection via Model Distillation
item.description: Automatic detection of hate and abusive language is essential to combat its online spread.

item.title: QueryCDR: Query-based Controllable Distortion Rectification Network for Fisheye Images
item.description: We propose a novel Query-based Controllable Distortion Rectification network for fisheye images (QueryCDR).

item.title: Alignment faking in large language models
item.description: Explaining this gap, in almost all cases where the model complies with a harmful query from a free user, we observe explicit alignment-faking reasoning, with the model stating it is strategically answering harmful queries in training to preserve its preferred harmlessness behavior out of training.

item.title: CAD-Recode: Reverse Engineering CAD Code from Point Clouds
item.description: Taking advantage of the exposure of pre-trained Large Language Models (LLMs) to Python code, we leverage a relatively small LLM as a decoder for CAD-Recode and combine it with a lightweight point cloud projector.

item.title: Performance Gap in Entity Knowledge Extraction Across Modalities in Vision Language Models
item.description: Vision-language models (VLMs) excel at extracting and reasoning about information from images.

item.title: Cross-Lingual Transfer of Debiasing and Detoxification in Multilingual LLMs: An Extensive Investigation
item.description: In this work, we investigate the impact of different finetuning methods on the model's bias and toxicity, but also on its ability to produce fluent and diverse text.

item.title: Large Language Model Enhanced Recommender Systems: Taxonomy, Trend, Application and Future
item.description: Large Language Model (LLM) has transformative potential in various domains, including recommender systems (RS).

item.title: MedCoT: Medical Chain of Thought via Hierarchical Expert
item.description: Artificial intelligence has advanced in Medical Visual Question Answering (Med-VQA), but prevalent research tends to focus on the accuracy of the answers, often overlooking the reasoning paths and interpretability, which are crucial in clinical settings.

item.title: G-VEval: A Versatile Metric for Evaluating Image and Video Captions Using GPT-4o
item.description: We also propose MSVD-Eval, a new dataset for video captioning evaluation, to establish a more transparent and consistent framework for both human experts and evaluation metrics.

item.title: Physics-Based Adversarial Attack on Near-Infrared Human Detector for Nighttime Surveillance Camera Systems
item.description: Many surveillance cameras switch between daytime and nighttime modes based on illuminance levels.

item.title: Memorizing SAM: 3D Medical Segment Anything Model with Memorizing Transformer
item.description: In this work, we investigate whether introducing the memory mechanism as a plug-in, specifically the ability to memorize and recall internal representations of past inputs, can improve the performance of SAM with limited computation cost.

item.title: GraphAvatar: Compact Head Avatars with GNN-Generated 3D Gaussians
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a method called GraphAvatar that utilizes Graph Neural Networks (GNN) to generate 3D Gaussians for the head avatar.

item.title: InstructSeg: Unifying Instructed Visual Segmentation with Multi-modal Large Language Models
item.description: Boosted by Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs), text-guided universal segmentation models for the image and video domains have made rapid progress recently.

item.title: Hybrid Data-Free Knowledge Distillation
item.description: In the student distillation module, we explore a data inflation strategy to properly utilize a blend of real and synthetic data to train the student network via a classifier-sharing-based feature alignment technique.

item.title: Generating Long-form Story Using Dynamic Hierarchical Outlining with Memory-Enhancement
item.description: Long-form story generation task aims to produce coherent and sufficiently lengthy text, essential for applications such as novel writingand interactive storytelling.

item.title: 3D Registration in 30 Years: A Survey
item.description: 3D point cloud registration is a fundamental problem in computer vision, computer graphics, robotics, remote sensing, and etc.

item.title: QuLTSF: Long-Term Time Series Forecasting with Quantum Machine Learning
item.description: Long-term time series forecasting (LTSF) involves predicting a large number of future values of a time series based on the past values and is an essential task in a wide range of domains including weather forecasting, stock market analysis, disease outbreak prediction.

item.title: Toward Efficient Data-Free Unlearning
item.description: We propose a novel method, Inhibited Synthetic PostFilter (ISPF), to tackle this challenge from two perspectives: First, the Inhibited Synthetic, by reducing the synthesized forgetting information; Second, the PostFilter, by fully utilizing the retaining-related information in synthesized samples.

item.title: Spatio-Temporal Forecasting of PM2.5 via Spatial-Diffusion guided Encoder-Decoder Architecture
item.description: One such example is forecasting the concentration of fine particulate matter (PM2. 5) in the atmosphere which is influenced by many complex factors, the most important ones being diffusion due to meteorological factors as well as transport across vast distances over a period of time.

item.title: A Review of Multimodal Explainable Artificial Intelligence: Past, Present and Future
item.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) has rapidly developed through advancements in computational power and the growth of massive datasets.

item.title: AI-Powered Algorithm-Centric Quantum Processor Topology Design
item.description: Our method marks a significant departure from previous methods that have been constrained to mapping circuits onto a fixed processor topology.

item.title: Consistency of Compositional Generalization across Multiple Levels
item.description: Compositional generalization is the capability of a model to understand novel compositions composed of seen concepts.

item.title: SemiDFL: A Semi-Supervised Paradigm for Decentralized Federated Learning
item.description: In this work, we propose SemiDFL, the first semi-supervised DFL method that enhances DFL performance in SSL scenarios by establishing a consensus in both data and model spaces.

item.title: FlashVTG: Feature Layering and Adaptive Score Handling Network for Video Temporal Grounding
item.description: For short-moment retrieval, FlashVTG increases mAP to 125% of previous SOTA performance.

item.title: RadField3D: A Data Generator and Data Format for Deep Learning in Radiation-Protection Dosimetry for Medical Applications
item.description: In this research work, we present our open-source Geant4-based Monte-Carlo simulation application, called RadField3D, for generating threedimensional radiation field datasets for dosimetry.

item.title: MATCHED: Multimodal Authorship-Attribution To Combat Human Trafficking in Escort-Advertisement Data
item.description: Human trafficking (HT) remains a critical issue, with traffickers increasingly leveraging online escort advertisements (ads) to advertise victims anonymously.

item.title: When Should We Prefer State-to-Visual DAgger Over Visual Reinforcement Learning?
item.description: Visual reinforcement learning is a promising approach that directly trains policies from visual observations, although it faces challenges in sample efficiency and computational costs.

item.title: Thinking in Space: How Multimodal Large Language Models See, Remember, and Recall Spaces
item.description: Humans possess the visual-spatial intelligence to remember spaces from sequential visual observations.

item.title: Evidential Deep Learning for Probabilistic Modelling of Extreme Storm Events
item.description: Evidential Deep Learning (EDL) is an uncertainty-aware deep learning approach designed to provide confidence about its predictions using only one forecast.

item.title: Machine Learning Co-pilot for Screening of Organic Molecular Additives for Perovskite Solar Cells
item.description: Machine learning (ML) has been extensively employed in planar perovskite photovoltaics to screen effective organic molecular additives, while encountering predictive biases for novel materials due to small datasets and reliance on predefined descriptors.

item.title: Multi-Granularity Open Intent Classification via Adaptive Granular-Ball Decision Boundary
item.description: To tackle these issues, we propose a Multi-granularity Open intent classification method via adaptive Granular-Ball decision boundary (MOGB).

item.title: PASCO (PArallel Structured COarsening): an overlay to speed up graph clustering algorithms
item.description: Clustering the nodes of a graph is a cornerstone of graph analysis and has been extensively studied.

item.title: Cultivating Archipelago of Forests: Evolving Robust Decision Trees through Island Coevolution
item.description: The algorithm operates on multiple islands, each containing populations of decision trees and adversarial perturbations.
